page.title: 15Recreation in rural Sowerby
page.content: Recreation is mainly "do it yourself" rather than organised commercial entertainment. A pond has been enlarged, camouflaged with conifers, broad leaved trees and reeds. The farmer encourages ducks to use it so that he can go duck shooting. A copse of elms has a large rookery and the farmer again shoots the birds. Fishing in the Cod Beck running through the area is popular with locals as well as visitors. One farmer's wife schools and breeds horses. Horse riding is a popular pastime, and anyone wishing to go fox hunting may join the local hunt. Several of the ladies belong to the neighbouring Women's Institutes. Several attend classes at local Further Education Centres.
